title: New 27in iMac is HERE!
description: PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE -   FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -   AUDIO:  Sennheiser AVX Digital Wireless -  Sony XLR Adapter -  Sony Hot Shoe Shotgun -  Tiny Sony Microphone -  DJI Mics -  Rode Podcaster Pro II -  Podcaster Mic -  Elgato Wave 3 Mic -   DRONES: DJI Mavic 3 -  DJI Mini 3 -  DJI Air 2S -   LIGHTING: Aputure 600d Pro -  Aputure Light Dome II -  Aputure Amaran 200d -  Aputure 35in Light Dome -  Aputure Lantern Softbox -   Sony CF Express A 160g + Card Reader-  Sony CF Express A 800g -     These links are affiliate and by using them youre helping out my channel! Thank you!     BECOME A CHANNEL MEMBER:
transcript: (electronic music) - Hey guys, it's Justine, and today I'm gonna be showing you the brand new iMac that Apple just announced. This is a brand new 5K 27 inch Retina Display model. And it also has something very, very special. Much like the new Pro Displays that you guys have seen, you now have the option to configure this model with a nano texture display. And what this does is it gives you that matte finish, but not just any matte finish. I have been editing on the Pro Display XDR for quite a while. And the difference between editing on that nano texture and the regular Retina on my previous iMac Pro, it is honestly like night and day. Anyway, this is the new 27 inch iMac. It's 65% faster with 6, 8, and 10-core processors. There's two different configurations for graphics, 55% faster GPU. You can also configure it up to 128 gigs of ram. I love that they're now including solid state drives across all models, and you can also configure it up to eight terabytes. And this is a really huge upgrade, especially for the iMac, because I feel like a lot of people are using this for so many different things, whether it's video editing, editing photos, even just doing Zoom calls. No matter what you're doing, having a solid state drive is so much more efficient and much faster. And again, we're talking about the regular iMac, not the iMac Pro. The iMac Pro is obviously geared way more towards professionals, but a lot of the things that that iMac Pro has is now trickling down into the iMac at a much lower price. I feel like the times now have shifted so significantly to everyone working from home, and an iMac I feel like is a really great family type computer. We had iMacs growing up all through when I lived with my parents. And it was really great because that sort of was the centerpiece to kind of like our household. And even back then, which I don't wanna, it was quite a while ago at this point, and even back then, like having this computer, we would watch shows on it. I would do homework, my sisters would do their homework, my dad would be reading the news, my mom would be using it for her work. So I feel like now even more than ever, because everybody is home, having this one sort of central device that really can do everything is incredible. I think now the problem is now that everybody's home, everybody's gonna wanna have an iMac. (electronic music) Even for me, even though I just got this one, I still use my iMac Pro a lot. Granted I do have one of the Mac Pros and I know I'm kind of in sort of a unique situation where my job basically revolves around reviewing technology and editing and production. This is kind of an unlikely situation, but the fact that I do have a Mac Pro and I do sometimes end up gravitating towards my iMac Pro because it really is all in one. It has the webcam built in, it has incredible speakers. I don't have to do anything, I just push a button. Everything that I want to use with the Mac Pro, it's all external. So if I want to add a webcam, I have to add a microphone, I have to add speakers. So you don't get that sort of just out of the box, ready to go. And with the new iMac, they did finally upgrade the webcam. I mean, this is seriously crazy because it's something that even now, people didn't use the webcams as much as they do now. All of these things has just made it so simple to start talking to your devices. The speakers and the webcam are now working in conjunction with the T2 Security Chip.
